thread.title: Toronto breaks 1984 record for highest temperature
thread.title_full: Toronto breaks 1984 record for highest temperature

title: Toronto breaks 1984 record for highest temperature
text:
#StarWeather Toronto breaks 1984 record for highest temperature The 33-year-old record high of 14.9C was broken on Thursday after temperatures hit 15.1C at 11 a.m. The temperature high for the afternoon is expected to reach 18C. The past few days in Toronto have seen record-breaking warm weather and sunshine, unusual for the middle of winter. ( Richard Lautens/Toronto Star ) By Evelyn Kwong Staff Reporter Thu., Feb. 23, 2017 
Balmy temperatures Thursday surpassed a 33-year-old record high of 14.9C on Feb. 23 that was set back in 1984. 
By 11 a.m., the temperature at Toronto Pearson Airport reached 15.1C, and is expected to rise up to 18C by 1 p.m. 
Need even more reason to head outside? The city will be seeing sun for most of the day, with a little bit of cloudiness which is a rare sight for winterâ€™s usual grayness. 
On Friday, temperatures dip down back down to a high of 4C which is still over the average temperatures for February. There will be a 30 percent chance of rain and drizzle. 
Saturday is forecasting for another double-digit day at 12C, but showers and strong winds are expected throughout the day.   
Just a few days ago, the city broke another temperature record last Saturday when temperatures hovered at 12 C, beating out the 2011 record at 11C. 
To contrast, the lowest temperature for today was at -19.4C in 1972.
